com.hazelcast.spi.impl.operationservice.impl

Class OperationServiceImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.spi.impl.operationservice.impl.OperationServiceImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InternalOperationService, PacketHandler, OperationService

    public final class OperationServiceImpl
extends Object
implements InternalOperationService, PacketHandler
    This is the implementation of the InternalOperationService.

    System Operation

    When a UrgentSystemOperation is invoked on this OperationService, it will be executed with a high urgency by making use of a urgent queue. So when the system is under load, and the operation queues are filled, then system operations are executed before normal operation. The advantage is that when a system is under pressure, it still is able to do things like recognizing new members in the cluster and moving partitions around.

    When a UrgentSystemOperation is send to a remote machine, it is wrapped in a Packet and the packet is marked as a urgent packet. When this packet is received on the remove OperationService, the urgent flag is checked and if needed, the operation is set on the urgent queue. So local and remote execution of System operations will obey the urgency.

    See Also:
    Invocation, InvocationBuilderImpl, PartitionInvocation, TargetInvocation

        public void dumpPerformanceMetrics(StringBuffer sb)
        Description copied from interface: OperationService
        Dumps all kinds of metrics: for example, performance. This can be used for performance analysis. In the future we'll have a more formal (such as map with key/value pairs) information.

        This methods is deprecated since 3.5. This feature will be dropped since it is an internal implementation detail and should not directly be exposed the the SPI user.

        Specified by:
        dumpPerformanceMetrics in interface OperationService

      • isAllowedToRunOnCallingThread

        public boolean isAllowedToRunOnCallingThread(Operation op)
        Description copied from interface: OperationService
        Returns true if the given operation is allowed to run on the calling thread, false otherwise. If this method returns true, then the operation can be executed using OperationService.runOperationOnCallingThread(Operation) method, otherwise OperationService.executeOperation(Operation) should be used.
        Specified by:
        isAllowedToRunOnCallingThread in interface OperationService
        Parameters:
        op - the operation to check.
        Returns:
        true if the operation is allowed to run on the calling thread, false otherwise.
